author: Guest
title: Wall Street Journal: 2 big victories for liberty at the Supreme Court
text:
It was a good day, make that a great day, for liberty and the Constitution at the Supreme Court recently. The justices delivered an overdue rebuke to overreaching regulators in a ruling that abolishes
Chevron deference, while they also reined in prosecutors who stretched the law in pursuit of Jan. 6 cases.
In arguably the most significant decision of the year, a 6-3 majority (Loper Bright Enterprises v. Raimondo) overturned the court’s 40-year-old Chevron doctrine that told judges to defer to agency interpretations of vague laws as long as they are “reasonable.” Now regulators will have a harder time bending laws, and Congress will have to legislate more clearly. Imagine that.
Chevron arose when judges were willy-nilly legislating from the bench, but its flaws were “apparent from the start,” as Chief Justice John Roberts explains for the majority. The doctrine lacked a constitutional basis and clashed with the Administrative Procedure Act’s command that courts “decide all relevant questions of law, interpret constitutional and statutory provisions.” From the start,
he says, Chevron was “a ‘rule in search of a justification,’ if it was ever coherent enough to be called a rule at all.”
People are also reading…
The doctrine spawned confusion and conflict in lower courts, including whether a given law was ambiguous in the first place. As Justice Antonin Scalia put it five years after Chevron was decided: “How clear is clear?” The chief says deference to regulators became “an impediment, rather than an aid, to accomplishing the basic judicial task.”
The high court hasn’t invoked Chevron since 2016, relying instead on basic statutory interpretive tools and its major questions doctrine, such as in West Virginia v. EPA. “At this point, all that remains of Chevron is a decaying husk with bold pretensions,” the chief writes.
The problem is that lower courts still rely on Chevron and cite it repeatedly to rubber stamp even the most dubious rules. See the D.C. Circuit Court of Appeals.
The court’s considerations about when to revere precedents also support its decision. Not only has Chevron proven unworkable, it “has undermined the very ‘rule of law’; values that stare decisis exists to secure,” the chief stresses. As Justice Neil Gorsuch notes in a powerful concurrence, “these antireliance harms” aren’t “distributed equally.” While “sophisticated entities and their lawyers may be able to keep pace with rule changes affecting their rights and responsibilities,” others may not.
Chevron “has led us to a strange place. One where authorities long thought reserved for Article III are transferred to Article II, where the scales of justice are tilted systematically in favor of the most powerful, where legal demands can change with every election even though the laws do not, and where the people are left to guess about their legal rights and responsibilities.”
Lacking a strong legal rebuttal, the three liberal justices fret about “judicial hubris” and the court turning “itself into the country’s administrative czar.” “The majority disdains restraint, and grasps for power,” Justice Elena Kagan writes in dissent. “Judges are not experts in the field.”
But the progressive impulse to defer to the rule of experts is one reason Americans are so frustrated with government. Some judges may run off the rails, but then some do that now. The crucial constitutional point is that each branch of government stays in its proper lane. ...
In Fischer v. United States, prosecutors charged a Jan. 6 rioter with violating the 2002 Sarbanes-Oxley Act, of all unlikely statutes.
The financial securities law makes it a crime to “corruptly” shred or conceal documents “with the intent to impair the object’s integrity or availability for use in an official proceeding.” This provision is followed by another one punishing anyone who “otherwise obstructs, influences, or impedes” such a proceeding.
The government argued this catchall applied to the rioter’s obstruction. Six justices disagreed. The catchall “was designed by Congress to capture other forms of evidence and other means of impairing its integrity or availability,”
the chief writes. He was joined by Justices Gorsuch, Clarence Thomas, Samuel Alito, Brett Kavanaugh and Ketanji Brown Jackson.
It would be “peculiar to conclude that in closing the Enron gap, Congress created a catch-all provision that reaches beyond the scenarios that prompted the legislation,” the chief adds. The government’s “novel interpretation would criminalize a broad swath of prosaic conduct, exposing activists and lobbyists alike to decades in prison.”
The court’s decisions safeguard individual liberty against overreaching government. Isn’t that why the Founders fought the Revolution?

author: OSEN
title: Injuries plague South Korea's women's football team ahead of East Asian Cup - CHOSUNBIZ
text: As the 2025 East Asian Cup approaches, the women's national football team has been hit with a series of injury setbacks.The Korea Football Association announced on the 3rd that "Lee Young-joo (Levante UD) has a left knee injury, and Park Soo-jung (Ulsan University of Science and Technology) has a right thigh injury, leading to the urgent selection of Kim Yoo-ri (Hwacheon KSPO)."The team, led by coach Shin Sang-woo, will participate in the 2025 East Asian Football Federation (EAFF) E-1 Championship, which will be held in Japan starting on the 9th. The national team will face China on the 9th, Japan on the 13th, and Taiwan on the 16th.The national team is struggling with consecutive injuries. On the 29th of last month, Choi Yoo-ri (Birmingham City) suffered a right thigh injury, and Kim Jin-hee (Gyeongju Hanwha) was sidelined with a left knee injury. Their absences will be filled by Hyun Seul-ki (Gyeongju Hanwha) and Maeng Da-hee (Hwacheon KSPO).The roster, originally consisting of 23 players, has been expanded with the addition of 3 more players; however, due to injuries, the final number of players called up has been confirmed at 25.[Photo] Lee Young-joo / Korea Football Association[OSEN]

organizations.name: Ulsan University of Science and Technology

author: Zacks Investment Research
title: Honeywell International Inc. (HON) Beats Stock Market Upswing: What Investors Need to Know - December 28, 2023 - Zacks.com
text:
Honeywell International Inc. ( HON Quick Quote HON - Free Report ) closed the most recent trading day at $209.17, moving +0.07% from the previous trading session. This change outpaced the S&P 500's 0.04% gain on the day. On the other hand, the Dow registered a gain of 0.14%, and the technology-centric Nasdaq decreased by 0.03%.
Coming into today, shares of the company had gained 7.6% in the past month. In that same time, the Conglomerates sector gained 7.51%, while the S&P 500 gained 5.28%.
Market participants will be closely following the financial results of Honeywell International Inc. in its upcoming release. On that day, Honeywell International Inc. is projected to report earnings of $2.59 per share, which would represent year-over-year growth of 2.78%. Alongside, our most recent consensus estimate is anticipating revenue of $9.7 billion, indicating a 5.63% upward movement from the same quarter last year.
For the entire fiscal year, the Zacks Consensus Estimates are projecting earnings of $9.16 per share and a revenue of $36.92 billion, representing changes of +4.57% and +4.11%, respectively, from the prior year.
It is also important to note the recent changes to analyst estimates for Honeywell International Inc. These revisions help to show the ever-changing nature of near-term business trends. Therefore, positive revisions in estimates convey analysts' confidence in the company's business performance and profit potential.
Our research suggests that these changes in estimates have a direct relationship with upcoming stock price performance. To benefit from this, we have developed the Zacks Rank, a proprietary model which takes these estimate changes into account and provides an actionable rating system.
The Zacks Rank system, running from #1 (Strong Buy) to #5 (Strong Sell), holds an admirable track record of superior performance, independently audited, with #1 stocks contributing an average annual return of +25% since 1988. Over the last 30 days, the Zacks Consensus EPS estimate has remained unchanged. Right now, Honeywell International Inc. possesses a Zacks Rank of #3 (Hold).
In terms of valuation, Honeywell International Inc. is currently trading at a Forward P/E ratio of 22.82. This denotes a premium relative to the industry's average Forward P/E of 17.78.
It's also important to note that HON currently trades at a PEG ratio of 2.68. Comparable to the widely accepted P/E ratio, the PEG ratio also accounts for the company's projected earnings growth. The Diversified Operations industry had an average PEG ratio of 2.54 as trading concluded yesterday.
The Diversified Operations industry is part of the Conglomerates sector. This group has a Zacks Industry Rank of 41, putting it in the top 17% of all 250+ industries.
The Zacks Industry Rank gauges the strength of our industry groups by measuring the average Zacks Rank of the individual stocks within the groups. Our research shows that the top 50% rated industries outperform the bottom half by a factor of 2 to 1.
Don't forget to use Zacks.com to keep track of all these stock-moving metrics, and others, in the upcoming trading sessions.

author: Quotidiano Sportivo
title: Errani e Vavassori, che storia: agli Us Open il primo Slam di una coppia tutta italiana
text:
Home
Tennis
Errani e Vavassori, che storia: agli Us Open il primo Slam di una coppia tutta italiana Errani e Vavassori, che storia: agli Us Open il primo Slam di una coppia tutta italiana Battuti in due set Young e Townsend. Il ‘duo’ nato con le Olimpiadi compie l’impresa a New York di GABRIELE TASSI - 5 settembre 2024 Sara Errani e Andrea Vavassori con il trofeo degli Us Open
Facebook
X
WhatsApp
Print
New York, 5 settembre 2024 – Sorrisi quando l’altro sbaglia, testatine amichevoli e urli d’esultanza dritti in faccia. Sara Errani e Andrea Vavassori alzano, anzi baciano, la coppa degli Us Open , ridefinendo il concetto di complicità.
La coppia partita da Wimbledon con l’idea di assaltare le Olimpiadi riscrive invece la storia Slam del doppio misto azzurro. Nessuno come loro, nell’anno in cui i più bei record dell’Italtennis si sono sgretolati.
Si giocava pure contro il campo, con il pubblico americano a sostenere Donald Young (ultima partita prima del ritiro per dedicarsi al Pickleball) e Taylor Townsend , regolati 7-6, 7-5.
Ma dietro cosa c’è? Tecnica? Tattica? Forse solo questione di chimica , anche se da sempre Sara – almeno nel doppio – un’abbonata Slam (questo è il suo 11°, è l’italiana più titolata nei Major), Wave si toglie finalmente la soddisfazione di un Major, sfiorato già tre volte in questa stagione. I due hanno più volte detto di trovarsi benissimo assieme, si sono allenati con il sorriso sulle labbra per conquistare lo Slam della leggerezza, in fondo “perché non provarci”.
Un momento che finisce dritto dritto fra quelli speciali per Sarita, nel doppio da sempre abituata ai grandi palcoscenici: “Condividerlo con Andrea è bellissimo per me - commenta la romagnola -. Quest'anno per me è stato incredibile".
Vavassori invece è alla sua prima grande gioia, dopo aver mancato di un soffio Australian Open e Roland Garros con Simone Bolelli: "E' un sogno diventato realtà per me e ci sono riuscito con Sara, che è una giocatrice e una donna straordinaria".
Lui il cannoniere, lei la formichina con il gioco capace di ossidare gli avversari colpo dopo colpo: hanno trovato la vittoria contro gli americani dal braccio veloce. Una storia appena cominciata e già così dolce.
© Riproduzione riservata
Continua a leggere tutte le notizie di sport su

author: Paola Andrea Augello González
title: Fuerte enfrentamiento entre Ayuso y Bergerot en la Asamblea por las investigaciones que involucran a la pareja de la presidenta
text:
La sesión de control de este jueves en la Asamblea de Madrid estuvo marcada por un tenso enfrentamiento entre la presidenta del gobierno regional, Isabel Díaz Ayuso, y la portavoz de Más Madrid, Manuela Bergerot, a raíz de las investigaciones judiciales que salpican a la pareja de Ayuso, Alberto González Amador. Un cruce de acusaciones que se produjo luego de que algunos medios de comunicación adelantaran que González Amador intentó desgravarse gastos correspondientes a sus vacaciones con la presidenta.
La disputa comenzó con la intervención de Bergerot, quien realizó una advertencia directa a la presidenta popular: “Su novio irá pa’lante y se sabrá toda la verdad”. Una frase que claramente hace referencia a la investigación del Juzgado de Instrucción número 19 de Madrid, en la que se señala que González Amador podría haber utilizado una sociedad instrumental para ocultar parte de sus ingresos. A este respecto, la portavoz de Más Madrid ironizó con que el novio de Ayuso “no va a la Puerta del Sol a hacer negocios, él tiene la Puerta del Sol en casa”, remarcando la cercanía del empresario al poder político.
En la misma línea, Bergerot detalló con tono crítico que González Amador intentó deducir gastos personales, mientras acusaba a la presidenta madrileña de vivir en un piso “pagado con fraude fiscal” y de utilizar fondos públicos para acceder a la sala VIP del aeropuerto de Barajas en sus viajes privados. “El Rolex y el hilo dental, el saxofón y el desodorante, los gastos más suntuosos y los más insignificantes, todos les sirven para eludir a Hacienda”, afirmó la líder de Más Madrid, subrayando las supuestas irregularidades fiscales dentro del entorno personal de la presidenta.
Ante las acusaciones de Bergerot, Ayuso defendió a su pareja, calificando la situación como un “ataque desmedido” orquestado por el Gobierno central para desprestigiar a un “ciudadano particular”. En este sentido, la presidenta regional aseguró que la investigación carece de base legal y que el expediente ha sido “troceado de manera fraudulenta” para perjudicar su imagen política. “Lo preocupante es que todo lo que me están contando no procede de una causa penal o de una multa de Hacienda, sino de un troceo de un expediente de manera fraudulenta para desguazar el prestigio de una persona por tener una relación sentimental con un político”, declaró Ayuso, tachando la estrategia de “estalinista” y contraria a los principios democráticos.
Más allá de defender a su pareja, Ayuso también saltó en defensa de su propia integridad, negando haber utilizado fondos públicos para sus viajes. “Yo sí que puedo estar muy tranquila. A mí nadie me paga un duro en ninguno de mis viajes”, afirmó, añadiendo que cualquier ciudadano que haya compartido con ella podría confirmar que se comporta como “un ciudadano más”. En este sentido, la presidenta de la Comunidad de Madrid explicó que la Dirección General de Policía le proporciona acceso a la sala VIP del aeropuerto por motivos de seguridad, al igual que ocurre con otras altas autoridades, como los ministros y sus familias.
Asimismo, mostrando confianza en que la Justicia esclarecerá los hechos, Ayuso aseguró que “el tiempo pone todo en su sitio”, y señaló que las acusaciones en su contra solo buscan desviar la atención de la “montaña de corrupción” que afecta al Gobierno central. Una montaña de corrupción que, según la presidenta, “es tan grande que, créanme, un hilo dental no lo va a tapar”.
En un tono más directo, la líder popular amplió sus críticas al Gobierno al señalar que “Hacienda debería, al menos, pedir las inspecciones fiscales de Koldo y de Ábalos”, sugiriendo que el Gobierno aplica un doble rasero en sus investigaciones. “A ellos se les regula, se silencia todo. Pero vamos a intentar volver con el novio de Ayuso, que tenemos mucho que tapar: lingotes, siete ministerios implicados, tramas millonarias”, enumeró la presidenta madrileña.
Del mismo modo, Ayuso acusó al Gobierno de filtrar información para atacar a su entorno personal, insinuando que las filtraciones podrían venir directamente de la vicepresidenta y ministra de Hacienda, María Jesús Montero, quien recientemente declaró ante los medios que “en los próximos días habrá más información que les escandalizará”. Unas palabras que para Ayuso no solo confirman las filtraciones de Montero, sino que además demuestran que son parte de una estrategia deliberada por parte del Gobierno.
De modo que Ayuso cerró su intervención defendiendo su gestión y advirtiendo que las filtraciones que afectan a su pareja podrían acarrear problemas judiciales para quienes las promueven. “Eso es lo que va a hacer que otros, insisto, tengan problemas judiciales de aquí hacia adelante. Porque mientras exista un Estado de Derecho y unas garantías democráticas, eso es ilegal”, sentenció la presidenta.
González Amador responde a Bergerot con una demanda Las acusaciones de Bergerot hacia la pareja de Ayuso no solo provocaron una fuerte reacción por parte de la presidenta, sino que también llevaron a González Amador a interponer una demanda contra la portavoz de Más Madrid. Hoy jueves, el empresario presentó una querella en la que reclama a Bergerot una compensación de 20.000 euros por haberlo llamado “delincuente” en un programa de Telemadrid y en un post de X, publicado el pasado miércoles 23 de octubre.
En la demanda, González Amador exige que Bergerot se retracte públicamente y elimine la publicación de X en la que escribió: “El novio de la presidenta es un delincuente, él mismo lo ha confesado”. Adicionalmente, el demandante solicita a la portavoz de Más Madrid que publique una rectificación en sus redes sociales y advierte que tomará nuevas medidas legales si persisten las declaraciones difamatorias, añadiendo un nuevo grado de complejidad a un conflicto que ya trascendió lo meramente político.
Ante la noticia de la demanda interpuesta por González Amador, Bergerot respondió en sus redes sociales, tildando el recurso legal como un intento para silenciarla. “Acabo de recibir una querella del novio de Ayuso y pretende pedirme 20.000 euros. Una querella para intentar silenciarnos, para que no digamos lo que sabe ya toda España. Señor Amador: ya tiene mucha tarea en los juzgados como para andarse querellando. Ojo con Quirón”, publicó la líder de Más Madrid .
Acabo de recibir una querella del novio de Ayuso y pretende pedirme 20.000 euros. Una querella para intentar silenciarnos, para que no digamos lo que sabe ya toda España.
Señor Amador: ya tiene mucha tarea en los juzgados como para andarse querellando. Ojo con Quirón.
— Manuela Bergerot (@manuelabergerot) October 24, 2024 En definitiva, se trata de un enfrentamiento legal que no toma a nadie por sorpresa, pues más allá de afectar la reputación de los implicados, la querella es casi un símbolo de la compleja e intensa batalla política que rodea a la Comunidad de Madrid. De modo que, entre acusaciones de corrupción, evasión fiscal y filtraciones, todo sugiere que este conflicto continuará escalando tanto en los tribunales como en la arena política, mientras ambos lados luchan por imponer su versión de los hechos.
Ayuso arremete contra el fiscal general y acusa al Gobierno de Sánchez de “prácticas mafiosas”

author: Zacks Investment Research
title: Emerson Electric (EMR) Rises As Market Takes a Dip: Key Facts - December 26, 2024 - Zacks.com
text:
In the latest market close, Emerson Electric ( EMR Quick Quote EMR - Free Report ) reached $126.39, with a +0.13% movement compared to the previous day. The stock outpaced the S&P 500's daily loss of 0.04%. At the same time, the Dow added 0.07%, and the tech-heavy Nasdaq lost 0.05%.
Shares of the maker of process controls systems, valves and analytical instruments have depreciated by 4.8% over the course of the past month, outperforming the Industrial Products sector's loss of 8.42% and lagging the S&P 500's gain of 1.05%.
The upcoming earnings release of Emerson Electric will be of great interest to investors. The company's upcoming EPS is projected at $1.28, signifying a 4.92% increase compared to the same quarter of the previous year. Alongside, our most recent consensus estimate is anticipating revenue of $4.23 billion, indicating a 2.81% upward movement from the same quarter last year.
For the full year, the Zacks Consensus Estimates project earnings of $5.94 per share and a revenue of $18.17 billion, demonstrating changes of +8.2% and +3.86%, respectively, from the preceding year.
It is also important to note the recent changes to analyst estimates for Emerson Electric. These latest adjustments often mirror the shifting dynamics of short-term business patterns. Therefore, positive revisions in estimates convey analysts' confidence in the company's business performance and profit potential.
Based on our research, we believe these estimate revisions are directly related to near-team stock moves. Investors can capitalize on this by using the Zacks Rank. This model considers these estimate changes and provides a simple, actionable rating system.
Ranging from #1 (Strong Buy) to #5 (Strong Sell), the Zacks Rank system has a proven, outside-audited track record of outperformance, with #1 stocks returning an average of +25% annually since 1988. Over the last 30 days, the Zacks Consensus EPS estimate has moved 0.19% lower. Emerson Electric is holding a Zacks Rank of #3 (Hold) right now.
Valuation is also important, so investors should note that Emerson Electric has a Forward P/E ratio of 21.26 right now. This valuation marks a discount compared to its industry's average Forward P/E of 22.96.
Investors should also note that EMR has a PEG ratio of 2.12 right now. The PEG ratio is similar to the widely-used P/E ratio, but this metric also takes the company's expected earnings growth rate into account. As the market closed yesterday, the Manufacturing - Electronics industry was having an average PEG ratio of 2.09.
The Manufacturing - Electronics industry is part of the Industrial Products sector. This group has a Zacks Industry Rank of 78, putting it in the top 32% of all 250+ industries.
The Zacks Industry Rank assesses the strength of our separate industry groups by calculating the average Zacks Rank of the individual stocks contained within the groups. Our research shows that the top 50% rated industries outperform the bottom half by a factor of 2 to 1.
Remember to apply Zacks.com to follow these and more stock-moving metrics during the upcoming trading sessions.

author: Agencia EFE
title: Amazon enviará al espacio sus primeros satélites de internet
text:
Amazon enviará al espacio sus primeros satélites de internet
El lanzamiento será el próximo miércoles.
PUBLICIDAD
Nueva York. El gigante tecnológico Amazon anunció este miércoles que enviará al espacio el próximo 9 de abril su primer lote de satélites de red de banda ancha, parte del proyecto Kuiper, que proporcionarán Internet de alta velocidad a “cualquier lugar del planeta”.
La misión, denominada KA-01 (una abreviación de Kuiper Atlas 1), se lanzará en un cohete de la empresa United Launch Alliance desde la Estación Espacial de Cabo Cañaveral, en Florida, según un comunicado de Amazon.
A las 12:00 (hora del este) se desplegarán 27 satélites a una altitud de 450 kilómetros sobre la Tierra, que ofrecerán Internet de alta velocidad y baja latencia, lo que hará que se tarde menos tiempo en transferir los datos a través de la red, indica la información
Amazon añadió que la iniciativa Kuiper incluirá en total más de 3,200 satélites avanzados en la órbita terrestre baja (a una altitud de 2,000 kilómetros o menos sobre la superficie de la Tierra).
Una vez que todos los satélites se hayan separado del cohete, el equipo de Kuiper se hará cargo de su gestión desde su centro de operaciones en Redmon, Washington, aclaro la compañía.
“Hemos realizado numerosas pruebas en tierra para preparar esta primera misión, pero hay cosas que solo se aprenden en el vuelo (...). Independientemente de cómo se desarrolle, este es solo el comienzo de nuestro viaje”, apuntó -en el comunicado- Rajeev Badyal, vicepresidente del proyecto Kuiper.
Según la empresa, los satélites de esta misión son “una mejora significativa” de dos satélites prototipo que probó durante su misión Protoflight en octubre de 2023, de manera que se ha mejorado el rendimiento de todos los sistemas a bordo, incluidos los procesadores y los paneles solares.
La compañía indicó que la página web de la misión ofrecerá información actualizada sobre el lanzamiento, además de una retransmisión en directo que comenzará aproximadamente 20 minutos antes del despegue.
Con Kuiper, Amazon competirá con otras empresas como Starlink -propiedad de Elon Musk-, que cuenta con más de 7,000 satélites de banda ancha, así como OneWeb o la china SpaceSail.

author: La Tribuna de Albacete
title: Los Hispanos neutralizan a Chile para empezar el Mundial
text: Balonmano Los 'Hispanos' neutralizan a Chile para empezar el Mundial Europa Press - jueves, 16 de enero de 2025 31 España 22 Chile La selección española masculina vence con contundencia a la chilena y empeza sin sustos su andadura en el Grupo F de la Ronda Preliminar Los 'Hispanos' neutralizan a Chile para empezar el Mundial - Foto: Beate Oma Dahle La selección española masculina de balonmano ha ganado este jueves por un claro 31-22 a la chilena en su primer partido del Campeonato del Mundo, que se está celebrando en Dinamarca, Noruega y Croacia, y ha empezado sin sustos su andadura en el Grupo F de la Ronda Preliminar.En el Unity Arena de Oslo, los 'Hispanos' tuvieron la puesta de largo de sus jóvenes perlas, ésas en las que tanto confía ya Jordi Ribera para el relevo generacional de una selección laureada. Eso sí, el combinado de Chile se lo puso difícil en el inicio de este encuentro, agarrado a la efectividad de Erwin Feuchtmann en tiros de proximidad.También convirtió el propio Feuchtmann dos lanzamientos de 7 metros, ante un Sergey Hernández titular y con mayor protagonismo que Gonzalo Pérez de Vargas. Por parte española, Imanol Garciandia era quien mejor interpretaba los planes en ataque, con cortes por delante de ambos centrales chilenos, a veces definiendo él y otras asistiendo al pivote.Los 'Hispanos' neutralizan a Chile para empezar el Mundial - Foto: Beate Oma DahleEsteban Salinas se unió a los peligros de una Chile que aprovechó dos faltas en ataque cometidas por Agustín Casado, como demostraron Rodrigo Aedo al contragolpe para marcar desde el extremo izquierdo y luego Feuchtmann poniendo el 5-8, sin haber transcurrido siquiera 10 minutos.El guardameta Felipe García había contribuido a esa ventaja chilena con un 7 metros parado a Dani Fernández, instancia que repitió más tarde entre arreón y arreón España. Para esa reacción del equipo entrenado por Ribera, el nombre clave había sido Djordje Cikusa, cuya entrada en la cancha asentó la defensa y propulsó la remontada antes del descanso.Con Ian Tarrafeta y Carlos Álvarez como puñales en los costados y al contragolpe, los 'Hispanos' se fueron al intermedio con un 17-13 algo más esperable en la previa de este debut mundialista. Pero hacía falta refrendar esa teórica superioridad ante el conjunto sudamericano, lo que aderezó el arranque de la segunda mitad, con varias sustituciones.Los 'Hispanos' neutralizan a Chile para empezar el Mundial - Foto: Beate Oma DahleLa profundidad de banquillo en España fue un arma que supo exprimir Ribera, especialmente tapando huecos atrás cuando los laterales rivales se cruzaban y propiciando, con ello, muchas transiciones de las que Dani Fernández y Tarrafeta sacaron jugo. Tampoco desentonaron Jan Gurri y Carlos Álvarez mientras las rentas españolas crecían y crecían (26-18).Con tranquilidad en los compases finales, y pese a un 0-3 de parcial en contra después de un tanto de Aedo al contragolpe, España abrochó su primer triunfo en este Mundial reñido. El otro arquero chileno, Vicente González, tuvo cuatro intervenciones de mérito e impidió una distancia más grande en el electrónico del pabellón de la capital noruega. , , , , , , , ,

author: Divya
title: Beware! Fake AI Video Tools Target Windows And Mac Users To Steal Personal Data
text:
[Tech News](https://www.news9live.com/technology/tech-news)
Beware! Fake AI Video Tools Target Windows And Mac Users To Steal Personal Data
This fake AI video generating tool can steal sensitive information such as passwords, login details, browsing history of Mozilla, Chrome and others on Windows and Mac devices. Here is how to keep yourself safe.
With the advancement of technology and AI these days, the popularity amongst netizens is also growing. However, the growing popularity is presenting an opportunity for cybercriminals to exploit the excited users. If you are one of those who always be excited to try new AI tools to create images or videos, then you must know that fake AI video-generating tools are on the rise!
As per a Bleeping Computer report, the fake AI video generators, which promise to offer free and simple video creation with the help of AI, are tricking users into downloading malware on their Windows and macOS devices to steal personal and sensitive information such as passwords, browsing history, wallets, and more.
How Fake AI Tools Trick Users
Scammers are taking advantage of the opportunity of rising demand for AI tools. Hackers use fake websites that look like legitimate AI video generators, appearing ads and search results on social media and search results. Once a user clicks on the ad, it takes you to a website which looks professional and trustworthy with the help of familiar elements like cookie banners, making it hard to tell if they’re fake or real. But as soon as you click the Download button, the trouble begins!
The malicious app secretly installs malware on your device. For Windows, the file is called “Edit-ProAI-Setup-newest_release.exe,” and for macOS, it’s named “EditProAi_v.4.36.dmg,” the report suggested. This malware includes two types of information-stealers: Lumma Stealer for Windows and AMOS for macOS.
Once the malware is installed on your device, it can steal sensitive information without your knowledge. From login credentials, passwords, cryptocurrency wallets, and other history saved in browsers like Chrome, Firefox, and Edge can be compromised. What do hackers do with this information? They gather it in a file and send it back to their server to further use it to steal money, break into other accounts, or sell it to other cybercriminals.
What Should You Do?
If you’ve downloaded one of these fake AI tools, it’s important to act quickly. First, change the passwords for all your online accounts, especially for banking, email, and cryptocurrency sites. The malware could have stolen your login credentials, so assume your accounts are at risk. Another important thing that you need to do is to enable “multi-factor authentication (MFA)” on all accounts to add an extra layer of security.
Apart from this, it is also crucial to be safe in future from such scams or fake apps. Hence, it is important to keep these points in mind:
- Before downloading anything, make sure that the website is legitimate while checking for its reviews, and details, and it has a secure connection such as HTTPS.
- Do not download from third-party apps. Always stick to the trusted sources. Some random pop-up ads? NEVER download from them.
